Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very well situated little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Philip B
Reviews.Content: Completely and tastefully renovated, spotlessly clean in an old, charming and typically Amsterdam building right on the Herengracht canal.Very well located, quiet and close to the centre, the Jordaan, restaurants and the museums, Discrete and pleasant reception and good breakfast in a pleasant room. We spent 5 nights in a small but very comfortable room with shower overlooking the canal. We are a couple in our late 50's and can highly recommend this little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately Average”
Reviews.Author: jenny a
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a while back. Although we booked an ensuite the tiolet was across the corridor, we did have a small hand sink in what was a cramped room. maybe we got the last room, breakfast was average as was almost everything else, what more can i say, just average. Although I must give credit to its location & a good humoured receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price and friendly (especially the cat)”
Reviews.Author: cournazac
Reviews.Content: This hotel has obviously been modernised since some of the reviews were posted - all rooms have en suite shower and toilet, which, if smallish, are bang up to date. Our room was not huge but perfectly adequate - you spend more time outside than in in Amsterdam ! Very clean, comfortable beds, nice view over the Herengracht, not noisy. The reception was friendly, if not smiling, but really helpful when it came to dealing with our car, for example. The breakfast was simple but, again perfectly adequate. So all in all, nothing negative here, with the big pluses of its location, very near the centre, and the price, more than reasonable. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect located hotel”
Reviews.Author: katizza
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Amsterdam and we stayed in a very lovely hotel, right on one of the most beautiful canals (Herengracht) in one of the most charming cities of Europe! The hotel has been freshly renovated - we were the first ones to stay in the room. At first we were concerned about the paint smell but the friendly Brazilian at the desk counter told us that the hotel had been very careful in picking paint that is not toxic. He promised we wouldn't wake up with a headache! Indeed we didn't! Actually, we had a great night's sleep, the beds were comfortable (twin beds), the room was silent (window facing the canal) and the sheets were super clean! The shower/bathroom are in the room and despite the small size, it has the newest technology ( you can regulate the water temperature!). We didn't have breakfast because it wasn't included in our rate. You can pay extra for breakfast but honestly there are so many nice cafes on the canals, that you might as well walk 5 minutes and enjoy a quiet breakfast on a picturesque bridge. I strongly recommend this hotel, a hidden treasure in downtown amsterdam. And for those who complain that the staircases are narrow and steep, don't bother going to Amsterdam then!! Staircases are steep in every house, hotel or shop and it's part of this city's personality. One last technical remark: the hotel rooms have nice wooden floors (no carpet)

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price and the location”
Reviews.Author: hdempsey
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean hotel, satisfactory breakfast. I thought we'd booked a double room, but it was two single beds pushed together. I'd recommend it as it was a good value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: marierose054
Reviews.Content: A small friendly hotel at the nice Herengracht. Close to everything. Our room was a basic double. Small and simple decorated but very clean and with good beds. No toilett and shower in the room. Shared toilett with 2 other rooms and it was clean, shower shared with one room and it ws small with very little space for clothes, towels but it works. The breakfast was ok with warm bread, fresh coffee, eggs, cerials, youghurt and fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great cat - great staff”
Reviews.Author: iseult72petunia
Reviews.Content: I found the staff to be pretty friendly, allowing me to check in early with my bags and leave them there on the last day until I was ready to head to the airport. The breakfast was good - they make a decent coffee and there was a good selection of food with plenty to eat. I was up on the top floor which was a bit of a haul and I was stuck between two other rooms with paper thin walls - screaming baby for two nights, followed by couple talking until 2 am, following by couple arguing in Spanish until I knocked on their door at midnight - so your sleep will be affected by how polite your neighbours are. My room itself was neat and bijou - 6' by 9' with a sink. Toilet across the hall, shower downstairs. The Dutch really know how to squeeze in a toilet and I found not only here but all over that you had to be careful not to trail your clothing in the toilet! The location of the hotel is grand - a pretty straight shot to the Dam, not far from Bijbels with its peaceful garden, and the Herengraacht area is beautiful. I also love cats so a friendly Maine Coon named Othello tops the bill - you are also not far from the Katten Kabinet if that is your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Location very good, but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: saltwaterrain
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be average, it was clean and had everything we needed for one night, but it was over priced! The location is the best thing about the hotel, it is in walking distance to all the main attractions of Amsterdam. I expected a better hotel for what we paid, but I am guessing we were paying for the location. The stairs are very steep, which I was aware of before staying so it is something to take into consideration when booking. The man on the front desk was not very friendly at all. We requested a double room, but were given two singles, which was a bit annoying, but we didn't mind too much for one night. Overall, it is an average hotel, but with a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, sparse hotel”
Reviews.Author: CapitolJ
Reviews.Content: We walked to everything for five days and loved where we were. Didn't sleep well, with thin walls and all-hours comings and goings - it was noisy. Didn't love sharing a toilet with folks on my floor, but it was always clean and available. Front desk staff helped us with some tickets and plans (printed tix we bought online using wifi and iPhone, and made some calls for us). Be prepared for: - steep stairs - noise - tiny rooms - mosquitoes in summer - a nice but never-changing breakfast - being near everything you want to see in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “'typical canal house on pretty canal but basic'”
Reviews.Author: claireinverness
Reviews.Content: we knew stairs would be steep so only took 1 case. breakfast was good, cheese, meats, croisants, yoghurts and more with lovely Othello (puss) sitting with us at breakfast. Room tiny, so basic, but ok if you're out all day. Only 4 coathangers and curtained off shower. Very quiet hotel when we stayed 5 nights. Very pretty canal area, close to Dam Sq and Westerkirk and Anne Frank's house. 2 excellent restuarants near NOT to be missed, 'Luden' is one, ask at reception for name of other one. turn L from hotel door, cross bridge R then 2nd bridge ahead ,.it's on right. Excellent tours available all over. Loved herons walking past me in Vondel Park. Loved Delft town square

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MHobkirk
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay on a canal in Amsterdam. Walking distance from the train station, flower market, and the Royal Palace. A quiet canal street, a historic house, and a good breakfast.

HotelInfo.Name: Hegra Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Herengracht 269, Amsterdam 1016 BJ, The Netherlands
